text:
In this video, you’ll see how to manage 
Migration Acceleration Program (MAP)
tagging for AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery.

With this feature, you can accelerate your 
migration to AWS by using automatic tagging

to easily identify workloads, as well as offset 
the ongoing costs of protecting your servers.

We’ll begin in the AWS Elastic Disaster 
Recovery Console, where we’ll navigate
to the default replication settings.

These settings determine how data is
 replicated from our source servers to AWS.

Let’s edit the settings to 
configure MAP program tagging.

Map tagging allows us to easily 
identify workloads with AWS tags.

First, we’ll check the box to add a MAP tag to 
newly added source servers and replication resources.

Newly added source servers and 
replication resources will be automatically
tagged with the “map-migrated” key.

Next, we’ll enter our unique MAP contract 
ID as the tag value, and save the settings.
Now let’s navigate to the Source servers

page to look at how to set up MAP 
tagging on an existing source server.

We’ll navigate to the replication 
settings for the first server.
Let’s edit the settings.

We’ll add a MAP tag to the existing 
source server and replication resources.
Save the settings.

The replication settings have been 
updated and the MAP tag has been applied.

You’ve just seen how to Manage 
Migration Acceleration Program Tagging
with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery.

You can learn more about this topic in 
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it’s your turn to try.
